publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3426 Bill Butler: Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer—That the Parliament wishes to pay tribute to the work of Bert Mullen (1920-1986), who was instrumental in the establishment of Western Credit Union, based in the Drumchapel area and widely acknowledged as Scotland’s first credit union, which has now grown into Drumchapel Community Credit Union, with over 2,500 senior and 500 junior members; acknowledges the role which Mr Mullen played as the first Scottish Director of the Credit Union League of Great Britain in the development of the movement nationally; notes that Nobel Peace Prize Winner, John Hume, will give the inaugural Bert Mullen Lecture on 20 October 2005, International Credit Union Day, and salutes the dedication and effort of those who, like Mr Mullen, pioneered the use of the unique credit union model to provide a source of affordable credit and encourage regular savings in their local communities. Supported by: Maureen Macmillan*, Patrick Harvie*, Tricia Marwick*, Christine May*, Des McNulty*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Nora Radcliffe*, Shiona Baird*, Mark Ballard*, Sarah Boyack*, Jackie Baillie*, Christine Grahame*, Trish Godman*, Mike Pringle*, Helen Eadie*, Chris Ballance*, Paul Martin*, Eleanor Scott*, Cathie Craigie*, Janis Hughes*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Michael McMahon*, John Swinburne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Pauline McNeill*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Susan Deacon*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Elaine Smith*
S2M-3426 Bert Mullen - Credit Union Pioneer (lodged on 17 October 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
